aima.core.probability.bayes

Interface ConditionalProbabilityTable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConditionalProbabilityDistribution
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CPT

    public interface ConditionalProbabilityTable
extends ConditionalProbabilityDistribution
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 512.

    A Conditional Probability Table, or CPT, can be used for representing conditional probabilities for discrete (finite) random variables. Each row in a CPT contains the conditional probability of each node value for a conditioning case.
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CategoricalDistribution getConditioningCase(AssignmentProposition... parentValues)
      A conditioning case is just a possible combination of values for the parent nodes - a miniature possible world, if you like.

      A conditioning case is just a possible combination of values for the parent nodes - a miniature possible world, if you like.

      Construct a Factor consisting of the Random Variables from the Conditional Probability Table that are not part of the evidence (see AIMA3e pg.

    • Method Detail

      • getConditioningCase

        CategoricalDistribution getConditioningCase(java.lang.Object... parentValues)
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalProbabilityDistribution
        A conditioning case is just a possible combination of values for the parent nodes - a miniature possible world, if you like. The returned distribution must sum to 1, because the entries represent an exhaustive set of cases for the random variable.
        Specified by:
        getConditioningCase in interface ConditionalProbabilityDistribution
        Parameters:
        parentValues - for the conditioning case. The ordering and size of parentValues must equal getParents() and their domains must match.
        Returns:
        the Probability Distribution for the Random Variable the Conditional Probability Distribution is On.
        See Also:
        ConditionalProbabilityDistribution.getOn(), ConditionalProbabilityDistribution.getParents()

      • getConditioningCase

        CategoricalDistribution getConditioningCase(AssignmentProposition... parentValues)
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalProbabilityDistribution
        A conditioning case is just a possible combination of values for the parent nodes - a miniature possible world, if you like. The returned distribution must sum to 1, because the entries represent an exhaustive set of cases for the random variable.
        Specified by:
        getConditioningCase in interface ConditionalProbabilityDistribution
        Parameters:
        parentValues - for the conditioning case. The size of parentValues must equal getParents() and their Random Variables must match.
        Returns:
        the Probability Distribution for the Random Variable the Conditional Probability Distribution is On.
        See Also:
        ConditionalProbabilityDistribution.getOn(), ConditionalProbabilityDistribution.getParents()

      • getFactorFor

        Factor getFactorFor(AssignmentProposition... evidence)
        Construct a Factor consisting of the Random Variables from the Conditional Probability Table that are not part of the evidence (see AIMA3e pg. 524).
        Parameters:
        evidence -
        Returns:
        a Factor for the Random Variables from the Conditional Probability Table that are not part of the evidence.
